titleStmt.title: William E. Russell et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7418

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned represent to Your Excellency that at the November term 1865 of the Adair Circuit Court, James Cundiff was adjudged to pay a fine of Twenty five dollars on an Indictment of an assault on the person of B F. Loving. Said Cundiff was an own Cousin of One Wm E Hancock, and Loving (in the absence of Hancock from home) had grossly insulted the wife of said Hancock which was the cause of the assault we pray that said Cundiff be relieved of said fine Except, Costs, and as in duty bound we will ever pray &c,

Wm E. Russell
Jno A Peebles
C. T. Dillingham
Willm F Neat
W. H. Walker
Jo. Coffey
C R Page
James T. Page

Copy of the Letter written by Loving
July 29th 1865
Mrs Hanco

Adair Cir Ct
vs
Jas Cundiff
$25
Assault
Remitted 11 Dec/65
